titles.title: HP352 We plough the fields with tractors

properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
We plough the fields with tractors, with drills we sow the land;
But growth is still the wondrous gift of God's almighty hand.
We add our fertilisers to help the growing grain,
But for its full fruition, it needs God's sun and rain.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
With many new machines now, we do the work each day;
We reap the fields with combines, we bale the new-mown hay.
But God it is who gives us inventive skills and drives,
Which lighten labour's drudgery and give us fuller lives.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
He only is the Maker of all galaxies and stars,
Of birds and beasts and flowers, and any life on Mars.
Atomic powers obey Him; yet still the birds are fed;
And still our prayer is answered, "Give us our daily bread".

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
We thank Thee then, O Father, for life so rich and good,
For seedtime and the harvest, the wealth of daily food.
No gifts have we to offer, for all Thy love imparts,
But what Thou most desirest, our humble, thankful hearts.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines:
All good gifts around us
Are sent from heaven above;
Then thank the Lord, O thank the Lord,
For all his love.
